reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I liked this idea of the new version of the bomb that was used in the movie The Big Bang Theory and the Big Bang in the Big Bang and the movie Big Brother in America but it didn’t make any difference for the movie and it was a bit too good of an idea to make for the first film of this

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another outstanding book by Steve Sheinkin
reviews.reviewText: As a long-time fan of Steven Sheinkin's narrative nonfiction books, I was not sure what to expect from his foray into creating a graphic novel. Well, he hit it out of the park. The graphic novel of "Bomb" pulls the reader into the exciting and real history of the development of the atomic bomb during WWII. A complex story is told in vivid graphic format and with deceiving simplicity. Thank you!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bomb is the graphic novel adaptation of Steve Sheinkin's book. This is the story of the creation of the atomic bomb. It gives an inside look into how the bomb was created and who was involved. I felt like the graphic novel was able to divide up the heavy factual information with appealing visuals to reach readers. I feel like this book will appeal to middle school readers and above.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing Historical Fiction Adaptation
reviews.reviewText: I've been wanting to pick up Sheinkin's original narrative nonfiction book, Bomb, for quite some time. I'm glad I was able to learn the story through graphic novel format, and I know this will reach a whole new audience of readers. This book took a very complex topic and presented it in a way that summarized while still detailing.The story is told in alternating perspectives of spy interrogation in the 1950s while flashing back to the creation of atomic bombs throughout 1940s. There was incredibly intense material, including the dropping of the bombs in Japan, but everything was shared in an age appropriate way. This would be a great way to introduce students to the basics of the a-bomb's history and the beginnings of the Cold War and Arms Race. I'm interested in now trying the chapter book to see what more information was included.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Book Kids Love
reviews.reviewText: I am a middle school librarian and our students love all of Steve Sheinkin's books. This newest one - a graphic novel - draws them in with the fabulous graphic format and with the superior storytelling of an important historical event. They not only learn but enjoy reading as they do so.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Adapted Book
reviews.reviewText: I love Bomb and Steve Sheinkin's other books. He is able to write narrative nonfiction in a way that is so compelling and interesting and I am always eager to learn more about history in his well-written books. With the Christopher Nolan Oppenheimer movie coming out this year, I think that conversations about what really happened at Los Alamos will be in the zeitgeist again, and I'm excited to have this book to share with young readers.I also like the graphic novel approach here -- I think this serves as a good introduction point to the longer narrative nonfiction books and, in my opinion, the tone of the graphic panels matches the text perfectly. I am sure I'll be recommending this book often throughout the coming year!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m so excited to share this graphic novel adaptation with my students! At times the narrative and cast of characters were confusing, but overall it takes the remarkable and tragic story of the creation of atomic bomb and makes it more accessible to more audiences.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I learned a lot
reviews.reviewText: I have read many articles about Oppenheimer and about Truman's decision to drop the bomb. I have visited Los Alamos and its history museum. "Bomb" pulls it all together, adding a lot of interesting info. It is very well written and illustrated, and moves along briskly. I couldn't put it down and read it in one sitting.
